#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Do Spring Flowers in Puff Paint and Watercolors
#Text=Tulips , daffodils , hyacinths and other flowers know when it is time to spring onto the scene and enliven the outdoors .
#Text=The beautiful , delicate flowers announce that warm days have arrived .
#Text=This art project encourages “ topsy-turvy tulips , ” “ dancing daffodils ” and “ hip-hopping hyacinths” -- -all of them determined to make the blank page their stage .
#Text=Puff paint is an easy drawing medium and watercolors can flow fast to cover big areas of the paper .
#Text=What a fun way to cure the woes of winter and spread joy to the doer -- -and the viewer .
#Text=Steps =
#Text=Preparing and Drawing
#Text=Prepare your supplies .
#Text=Open a pad of any size 140 lb. watercolor paper and give the page stability by keeping it attached to the binding .
#Text=Open a box of watercolors , wet each pad of color and set it aside .
#Text=Have at least a small , round , pointed brush , a bigger round brush and a ½ inch flat brush .
#Text=You will also need a pencil , water container and tissues to mop of excess water .
#Text=Purchase a colorful array of puff paints .
#Text=They are readily available at the craft or discount store .
#Text=If you have n’t tried them , experiment doing lines on scrap paper by squeezing the paint through the dispenser top .
#Text=You will quickly learn that they take a little time to dry so you will need to keep your hands from rubbing through and smearing a wet area .
#Text=A hairdryer will hasten the wait time for drying .
#Text=Draw some common spring flowers lightly .
#Text=in pencil , on your watercolor paper .
#Text=Try a tulip , daffodil , hyacinth , daisy , dandelion , pansy , petunia , etc. Do them different sizes and at many angles so they look as though they are dancing over the page .
#Text=Do n’t forget to add the leaves to each flower .
#Text=Painting
#Text=Draw over the lines with puff paints .
#Text=Soon you will gain confidence and you wo n’t even have to draw the guide lines first .
#Text=Let your flowers gain new personalities by keeping the drawing loose and rhythmic .
#Text=Use the hairdryer often to make sure the flowers are completely dry to avoid smearing them as you continue to work .
#Text=When satisfied with how it looks , prop up the paper and stand back .
#Text=Think how you might finish the work .
#Text=Will you link the flowers with watercolor shapes and lines ?
#Text=You can also use the watercolors to fill in the flowers and leaves or simply to draw more flowers .
#Text=Might you add directional arrows or numbers ?
#Text=Footprints ?
#Text=Let you imagination go free and when you have decided , start painting with your watercolors .
#Text=Finish the background .
#Text=You could just paint the flowers and use a green line to string them all together .
#Text=You could do the entire background in appropriate colors .
#Text=You could paint an abstract background of colors and shapes .
#Text=You could paint a fence around the flowers .
#Text=You could bring in clouds and pieces of blue sky .
#Text=The possibilities are endless .
#Text=Do the watercolor painting part of this project to the point where you are happy with it .
#Text=Allow the piece to dry .
#Text=Evaluate it and punch up areas that need it .
#Text=Extending the Activity
#Text=Try the lesson again .
#Text=Turn to a fresh piece of paper , but this time , set a whole new plan into action .
#Text=Keeping spring flowers as your theme , think about how you might do them differently .
#Text=Perhaps this time , make the flowers more realistic and put them in a garden setting .
#Text=Put the flowers in pots and have them in a sunny window .
#Text=Use you imagination and try to make this art piece very different and perhaps more formally organized than the last one .
#Text=Make wearable art .
#Text=Before putting this project behind you , go out and purchase a plain white t-shirt .
#Text=Use the puff paints to , once again , draw flowers .
#Text=This time use other colors of puff paint to fill in the blossoms and leaves .
#Text=This paint is designed to work on cotton fabrics .
#Text=( Be warned , though , save the watercolors for work on paper . )
#Text=Wear your art piece as you go through your day , knowing that you have brought the flowers front and center for all to see and enjoy .
#Text=Tips
#Text=The key to this project is the energy captured in the drawing of the flowers .
#Text=Bear in mind that the flowers are trying to show their happiness at surprising us by blooming .
#Text=Imagine that they take great pride in making people happy .
#Text=If you make a wrong line or mark with puff paints , there is no removing it , so try to incorporate it into your design .
#Text=A mistake can sometimes open a new direction of thought and make something better than it might have otherwise been .
#Text=In other words , embrace your mistakes and strive to turn them into success .
